src:
Independiente (F) se ilusiona con clasificar
02 Nov 2019 by Deportivo
Independiente de Fernández sumó ayer tres puntos importantes al superar, como local, a Independiente de Beltrán por 1 a 0, en el partido que abrió la última fecha del Torneo Anual “Pablo Toviggino”, que organiza la Liga Santiagueña de Fútbol.
El volante Matías Fernández, a los dos minutos del complemento, le dio la victoria al “Aurinegro”.
Con los tres puntos, “Inde” quedó en la segunda posición con 13 puntos, al igual que Unión de Beltrán, pero con mayor diferencia de gol, por lo que ahora deberá esperar una derrota del Cruzado ante Instituto Santiago.
Si el equipo beltranense empata, Independiente de Fernández dependerá de otros resultados para clasificarse como el mejor tercero.
text:
Sensei Gakuen is the first time in 18 years.

02 Nov 2019

“Autumn High School Baseball Shikoku Tournament, Semi-Final, Ensei Gakuen 13-2 Okatoyo” (2nd, Oronamin C Stadium)
Toshinsei Gakuen (1st place in Kagawa) defeated Yutaka Oka (2nd place in Kochi) in the 6th cold with 17 hits and 13 points, and advanced to the final. Since 2002, he has taken the right lamp for next year's Senbatsu participation in 18 years.
Tosei Seigakuen, which was pre-empted by 2 points for the first time, was held 5 times in 1-2, and it was the same time in the left-front time of Fukui 野 outfielder (2 years) from No.3 to No.3. Infielder (2 years) won over the left and released 2 runs. The batting line that gained momentum after taking 5 points in this round decided 7 matches in the next 6 rounds.
The thrower, the starting Ace's left arm, pitcher Yukito Murakami (2 years), held the Okatoyo hit line 6 times 6 hits and 2 runs. Director Nishimura (40) narrowed his eyes and said, “I was able to demonstrate my power in the biggest game. The players did well.” Nakamura of the winning arch thought, “I entered the moment I hit it. I enjoyed it. "
Jinsei Gakuen will face Meitoku Gijuku (Kochi 3rd) in the final on the 3rd.
